snippet: Voters express outrage over corporate contributions and expenditures in elections.
abstract: Editorial praises Montana voters for overwhelmingly approving Initiative 166, measure that requires state's congressional delegation to propose a constitutional amendment that would prohibit corporate contributions and expenditures in its elections; says while  law may not be enacted anytime soon, it is understandable expression of outrage about harmful intervention in Montana's campaign system.
lead_paragraph: Voters express outrage over corporate contributions and expenditures in elections.

keywords.value: Citizens United v Federal Election Commission (Supreme Court Decision)
keywords.name: subject
